title: Minet Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Ian Day [CC BY-SA 2.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Honey bee on bristly ox tongue at Minet Country Park

images.title: Ian Day [CC BY-SA 2.0 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pond, Minet Country Park. The country park is newly created from a derelict area used partly as car boot sale, & for motor cycle scrambling. It is now an attractive country park. Its features include a cycle track, children's playground, lodge, & areas that make it a nature reserve appreciated by many bird species & other wild life.

images.title: Ian Day / Giant hogweed near the Yeading Brook
images.caption: Giant hogweed near the Yeading Brook to the south of the park. This "escapee" from Kew Gardens has spread along the waterways.

images.title: Nigel Cox / Hayes Bypass Channel
images.caption: Hayes Bypass Channel to the south of the park. This concrete conduit is an artificial flood relief channel that takes off from Yeading Brook at TQ 113 815 and rejoins it at TQ 106 794, running between Hayes to the west and Southall to the east.

images.title: David Hawgood / Pipe bridge over Paddington Branch canal
images.caption: Pipe bridge over Paddington Branch canal. This is a view of the canal which runs along the eastern side of the park.

images.title: J Taylor / Yeading Brook with Mallard - from the east side of the Parkway
images.caption: Yeading Brook with Mallard

description: This country park in Hillingdon includes ponds, grassland and a variety of wild plants and flowers. There's some nice footpaths to follow around the site which includes picnic areas, meadows and hedgerows. It's also home to the Hillingdon Cycle Circuit. The purpose-built road cycling circuit is about 1 mile long and a great place for a leisurely ride. The video below shows the nice wide surfaced path with views over the park. The Grand Union Canal passes the south side of the park so it's easy to extend your outing by picking up the towpath. If you head west you can visit Lake Farm Country Park where you will find meadows, grassland, a trim trail and a BMX track. The long distance Hillingdon Trail also passes through the park. You can follow it north and then west to visit the pretty Yeading Brook .

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The park is a popular place for dog walkers so you're likely to see other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head north west along the Hillingdon Trail and you can link up with the Colne Valley Trail near Harefield. The shared walking and cycling trail will take you along a series of pretty lakes and the River Colne. The Celandine Route also runs just to the east of the trail. It will take you along the River Pinn from Pinner to Cowley. For more walking ideas in the area see the London Walks page.

display_address: The Parkway, Yeading, London Borough of Hillingdon, London, Greater London, England, UB3 3QE, United Kingdom
